topics.body:
I'm going to play LoL in a little bit and I had another random thought; I know I sound like a broken record about AI development, but there's been a number of developments into we're starting to understand how the human brain works and it keeps coming back to the subject of AI.

Anyways you already know my position on AI, but I realized something there will be a robot uprising in the non-traditional sense.  What I mean by this is that obviously humans will always be needed at some level for certain jobs and such to which we're talking a long time time until AI and robots reach the point at which they can fully and totally 100% replace humans.  Rather what I mean by this is chances are they're going to take over the business world.  Let's say a android has the intelligence of a human; simply put humans as CEO's and business owners would not be able to compete.  Humans running a business need to sign paperwork, go to meetings, tell their subordinates what to do and then go through fifty steps before every actually doing anything.  A AI boss on the other hand could just plug into a computer and done.  If there ever is to be a robot uprising it would be them taking control away from humans for the CEO positions at companies.  Which honestly I can't say is a bad thing because a lot of times CEO's do dumb shit that collapse companies; having a AI boss instead would mean far more financially stable companies.  Chances are humans would lose control over the financial world and by proxy lose a lot of power, but Idunno considering how the very basis of the reason why financial crashes exist is because of a person doing something stupid having a chain reaction maybe that would actually be a good thing.

topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53eed4c463687210fab50000#post_53eed4c463687210fab50000
[bq="gasmaskangel"]"@Shadow_the_Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53eecd0963687269a5250100#post_53eecd0963687269a5250100
I'm not sure that would work as well since the first person perspective goes a long way towards making things terrifying in those games.

What makes me think Freddy's could work is how little actual interaction you have with the game world. You don't really explore the world.[/bq]

If you are thinking about a movie that is recorded in cameras, then people will complain that will be a "ripoff" of Paranormal Activity 2. Also, like other videogame movies, Hollywood will change a lot of things just to make the movie more dramatic, like, how the 4 kids disappear, the others security guards, and the question of how your partner from the phone knows what the mechanical things are capable of, but still he sounds like he doesn't about your life.

Update on ISIS:
Well it's apparent how this shit's going to resolve itself.  Basically everyone in Syria, ISIS controlled areas of Syria and Iraq are getting the fuck out of dodge.

At this rate there's not going to be a Syria/northwest Iraq cause people are running for wherever they can go.

"@Shadow_the_Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53eef45f6368727d5fe30000#post_53eef45f6368727d5fe30000
A lot (even most) horror movies produced these days are independent affairs. Seriously, the last thing you want with a horror movie is a big studio behind it because while they might have the budget for good cgi they'll likely cut it to a PG-13 and make the whole thing just the work of a Saw style killer.
